text: With  $D$  satisfying the conditions in  $\mathbb{I}$ , let  $r(S_{\phi}(E_{D^{\prime}}))$  and  $r(S_{\hat{\phi}}(\hat{E}_D))$  denote the rank, as  $\mathbb{F}_3$ - vector spaces, of the Selmer groups  $S_{\phi}(E_{D^{\prime}})$  and  $S_{\hat{\phi}}(\hat{E}_D)$ , relative to the isogenies  $\phi$  and  $\hat{\phi}$ , of the curves  $E_{D^{\prime}}$  and  $\hat{E}_D$  respectively, over  $\mathbb{Q}$ . Denote by  $r_3(D)$  and  $r_3(D^{\prime})$  the rank of the 3- part of the ideal class group  $\mathcal{CL}(K_D)$  and  $\mathcal{CL}(K_{D^{\prime}})$  of  $K_D$  and  $K_{D^{\prime}}$  respectively. In the next section we will compute the precise rank for the Selmer groups  $S_{\phi}(E_{D^{\prime}})$  and  $S_{\hat{\phi}}(\hat{E}_D)$  and obtain a parity result regarding the rank of the curves  $E_{D^{\prime}}$ .
3. ON THE 3-SELMER GROUP AND RANK OF THE ELLIPTIC CURVES  $E_{D^{\prime}}$
By employing the results of Satge [12, Section 3], we compute below the precise rank for the Selmer groups  $S_{\phi}$  and  $S_{\hat{\phi}}$

Proposition 3.1. With  $D$  satisfying the congruence conditions in  $\mathbb{I}$ , the rank of the Selmer groups  $S_{\phi}(E_{D^{\prime}})$  and  $S_{\hat{\phi}}(\hat{E}_D)$  of the curves  $E_{D^{\prime}}$  and  $\hat{E}_D$  are as follows:

Proof. Our elliptic curves  $E_{D^{\prime}}$  have a constant term equal to  $16D^{\prime} > 0$ . With  $D^{\prime}$  squarefree and with  $3^{\prime}||16D^{\prime}$ , Lemma 3.1 in [12] is vacuously true. Now  $3||16D^{\prime}$  and, given the congruence condition  $D\equiv 2$  mod 3, we have that  $- 16D\equiv 1$  mod 3. Therefore, from Proposition 3.2(1) of [12] we have that  $r(S_{\hat{\phi}}(E_{D^{\prime}})) = r_3(D^{\prime})$ . Finally, since  $16D^{\prime} > 0$ , Proposition 3.3.1 of [12] gives  $r(S_{\hat{\phi}}(\hat{E}_D)) = r_3(D^{\prime}) + 1$ .

As in Remark 2.3 we denote by  $S_{3}(\hat{E}_{D})$  and  $S_{3}(E_{D^{\prime}})$  the 3- Selmer group of the corresponding elliptic curves. Its rank will be denoted by  $r(S_{3}(E_{D^{\prime}}))$  and similarly for  $\hat{E}_D$ . We now consider the exact sequence ([11, Corollary 1])

Since our curves have no rational 3- torsion points, the first term of (10) is trivial. As it is known, because of the non- degenerate alternating pairing on  $\frac{\mathrm{III}(\hat{E}_D)[\hat{\phi}]}{\phi(\mathrm{III}(E_{D^{\prime}})[3])}$  (defined by Casseis in [4]), this last term is an even- dimensional  $\mathbb{F}_3$ - vector space (assuming finiteness of the Tate- Shafarevich group). Therefore, we obtain the following result regarding the parity of the rank of the 3- Selmer group and the ranks of the two Selmer groups  $S_{\phi}(E_{D^{\prime}})$  and  $S_{\hat{\phi}}(\hat{E}_D)$ :
Corollary 3.2. The elliptic curves  $E_{D^{\prime}}$  have odd rank.
